business.headline: How will insurance industry trends create new opportunities in 2026?Powered by artificial intelligence, rising climate risks, and changing customer expectations, the insurance industry is now silently transforming itself. Some of the trends that we may see in 2026 could look very different from what most people expect today.

Gold, silver extend record rally: Should you buy now?With gold anchoring portfolios and silver leading returns, should investors keep adding exposure, or step back and wait as record prices test discipline and long-term allocation strategies?

Is India's real estate market entering a more mature and institutional phase?Forces such as digitisation, institutional capital and changing consumer preferences reshaped the sector. More than just building structures, real estate is now about creating ecosystems that are interoperable with transit, logistics, digital infrastructure and services.

What happens if you do not file a revised ITR after your refund is put on holdWhen a return is flagged under the risk management framework, the refund does not move forward on its own. If a taxpayer does not revise the return or respond to the issue flagged, the refund can remain on hold indefinitely, even if the claim is otherwise genuine.

RVNL share price zooms over 11% today. What investors need to knowAt around 10:32 am, the RVNL share price was trading 11.01% higher at Rs 383.75 on the BSE, making it one of the top-performing public sector stocks during the session.

IRFC shares jump over 7% today. Here's what's driving the rallyAt around 10:32 am, IRFC shares were trading 7.42% higher on the BSE at Rs 130.50, emerging as one of the top gainers among public sector stocks during the session.

RVNL, IRFC, IRCTC: Why are these railway stocks rising today?At around 9:55 am, IRCTC was up 1.35% at Rs 688.85 on the BSE, while Rail Vikas Nigam Limited surged 8.94% to Rs 376.60. Indian Railway Finance Corporation also saw strong buying, rising 6.07% to Rs 128.87.

Eggs on the boil: Why prices are high and when they might coolEgg prices reflect a market resetting after years of strain, where higher costs, cautious supply, and steady demand mean consumers should expect easing, not a return to cheap eggs soon.

Why Dalal Street's Santa rally failed to take off this yearWhat began as a tentative Santa rally faded quietly, leaving benchmark indices range-bound and investors asking why seasonal cheer failed to translate into sustained gains. Read on to find out what it means for Dalal Street investors.

Sensex, Nifty slip at open as Dalal Street rally loses momentumAt around 9:18 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 95.26 points at 85,313.44, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 40.80 points to trade at 26,101.30. Broader markets also traded in the red, with volatility ticking up during early trade.

Why are egg prices crossing Rs 8 in many Indian cities this winter?Eggs, often seen as one of the most affordable sources of protein, are turning expensive in many Indian cities this winter. As prices move past Rs 8 per piece, consumers are keen to understand what is pushing rates higher.

Revised or belated ITR? What taxpayers should file before December 31With the December 31 deadline fast approaching, many taxpayers are unsure whether they need to file a revised or a belated income tax return. Recent alerts from the income tax department have made it even more important to understand the right option.

8th Pay Commission: How inflation could shape salary and pension revisionsAs discussions around the 8th Pay Commission gather pace, the debate around pay hikes has already begun. Inflation may be under control on paper, yet higher rents and household expenses are shaping expectations from the next salary and pension revision.

Why EPF claims get rejected and how employees can avoid itAn EPF claim rejection can be frustrating, especially when employees need the money urgently. Understanding why claims get rejected and how to avoid common mistakes can save time and stress.

Centre okays 3 new airlines after IndiGo chaos: Shankh Air, Al Hind Air, FlyExpressShankh Air, Al Hind Air and FlyExpress have received no objection certificates from the civil aviation ministry, as the government looks to reduce heavy dependence on a few airlines following recent disruption at IndiGo.
Sensex ends 116 points lower, Nifty below 26,200; Trent gained 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 116.14 points to close at 85,408.70, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 35.05 points to end at 85,408.70.

Facing pension delays? EPFO sets new rules to fix EPS contribution mistakesPension delays have long been a worry for many employees. To address this, the EPFO has introduced new rules to correct mistakes in EPS contributions and ensure pension claims are settled smoothly.

8th Pay Commission: How the fitment factor will shape salary and pension increasesAs talks around the 8th Pay Commission gather pace, government employees and pensioners are closely watching one number that could change their monthly income. The fitment factor is set to be the main driver of salary and pension revisions under the new pay panel.

Still waiting for your income tax refund? Simple ways to check your ITR statusWaiting for an income tax refund can be frustrating, especially after filing your return on time. While delays are common, tracking your ITR status online is easy and can give you clarity on where things stand.

Pakistan sells national carrier PIA for Rs 4,300 crore after IMF diktatPakistan, which is surviving on international loans and dole, sold its flag-carrier Pakistan International Airlines (PIA) on Wednesday for PKR 13,500 crore (Rs 4,300 crore). The Pakistani government had to privatise the airline under IMF loan conditions. The Arif Habib Group emerged as the highest bidder.

How Salman Khan plans to ring in 60th birthday on December 27: Exclusive info Source says that Salman Khan's 60th birthday plans reportedly include the customary party on December 27 for near and dear ones at Panvel farmhouse, and a very special video for the superstar

Irrfan shot Angrezi Medium in severe pain, says costume designer: He was ailing Costume designer Smriti Chauhan has shared how Irrfan continued shooting Angrezi Medium despite intense pain and deteriorating health, requiring constant costume adjustments for comfort.

Avatar Fire and Ash becomes 2025's biggest Hollywood hit in India, tops F1 Avatar: Fire and Ash box office Week 1 report: James Cameron's film has become the biggest Hollywood grosser of 2025 in India, surpassing F1 in just seven days.

Mark: Kichcha Sudeep calls fans' response his 'biggest reward' Actor Kichcha Sudeep has thanked fans following the release of the action thriller Mark. The actor described the outpouring of support as an overwhelming experience that left him at a loss for words.

Neetu Kapoor shares unseen Christmas photo with Ranbir, Alia, Raha: Cherish family Neetu Kapoor shared an unseen family photo from the Kapoor clan's Christmas celebration, featuring Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt and daughter Raha Kapoor, which quickly caught fans' attention online.

Jana Nayagan audio launch: No political speech at Vijay's event, security tightened Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan audio launch will take place in Malaysia on December 27. Malaysian police have issued clear guidelines for the event, emphasising an absolute ban on political speeches and symbols.

It's a wrap up for Meghna Gulzar's Daayra with Kareena and Prithivraj Filming for director Meghna Gulzar's new investigative crime thriller Daayra, starring Kareena Kapoor Khan and Prithviraj Sukumaran, has concluded. The film, produced by Junglee Pictures and Pen Studios, is now moving to post-production ahead of its planned 2026 theatrical release.

Ram Charan's Peddi schedule in Capital: Red Fort, Rashtrapati Bhawan, Delhi winters The filming of Ram Charan's sports drama 'Peddi' progresses steadily, with the Delhi schedule completed and new phases underway, keeping the project on track for its planned March 2026 release.

Actor Vijay off to Malaysia for Jana Nayagan event: Nelson, Prabhudheva to attend Actor Vijay has left for Malaysia to attend the Jana Nayagan audio launch and tribute concert. The grand event marks his farewell film before entering politics and features many prominent artists.

RGV compares Aditya Dhar to Francis Ford Coppola in 10th post praising Dhurandhar Ram Gopal Varma praised Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar in his 10th post on X, comparing the film to the works of the legendary American filmmaker, Francis Ford Coppola. He called it a benchmark for Indian cinema.

Actor Nivin Pauly slams Kerala Film Producers' box office list: No need Actor Nivin Pauly has slammed the Kerala Film Producer Association's decision to release a list detailing the commercial outcomes of Malayalam films released in 2025. The move has drawn criticism from both audiences and industry professionals.

Stranger Things 5 V2 review: A set-up heavy chapter that's frustratingly cautiousRelease Date:Fri Dec 26, 2025 Stranger Things season 5 volume 2 arrives with high expectations and emotional character moments. The season tests patience with slow pacing but highlights key relationships and plot reveals.

Gaurav Khanna defends wife Akansha Chamola after dance video backlash Bigg Boss 19 winner Gaurav Khanna has defended his wife, Akanksha Chamola, following online criticism after a video of her dancing at a party gained attention.

Mark vs 45 box office Day 1: Sudeep's film outperforms Shiva Rajkumar's actioner Kichcha Sudeep's Mark outperformed Shiva Rajkumar and Upendra's 45 at the Karnataka box office on Christmas Day, posting higher occupancy percentages and audience turnout across key regions.

Karisma Kapoor's children honour late father Sunjay with polo jerseys on Christmas Sunjay Kapur's children, Samaira and Kiaan, wore their late father's polo jerseys during Christmas. A picture of their touching gesture has emerged online.

Stranger Things Season 5 Volume 2 out: Noah Schnapp thanks fans for their love Stranger Things Season 5 Volume 2 is now streaming on Netflix. Actor Noah Schnapp marked the occasion by posting a heartfelt note on Instagram. He encouraged fans to cherish the final moments of the series as it reaches its concluding episodes.

Rashmika, Vijay Deverakonda wear similar hoodies as they jet off for Christmas trip Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda were seen in matching hoodies during their Christmas vacation. The couple's engagement rumours continue as they prepare for a wedding in early 2026.

Dhurandhar Ranveer cheers as Rupali Ganguly's mother wins internet with Shararat Dhurandhar star Ranveer Singh shared his excitement after watching a video of Rupali Ganguly's mother dancing to the song Shararat. The latter has won the heart of not just the starcast of the film but also celebrities and fans.

general news.headline: Centre opposes plea for GST cut on air purifiers, questions petitioner's motiveThe Centre told the Delhi High Court that no urgent GST Council meeting has been called to discuss reduction of GST on air purifiers.

Udaipur rape-accused CEO's IT firm rated itself 4.7 on women friendlinessA female manager of an IT firm in Rajasthan Udaipur has accused her CEO Jeetesh Sisodia, executive head Shilpa Sirohi and her husband Gaurav of gangraping her after a birthday party earlier this month.

Bangladesh: What Tarique Rahman's 'plan' signals for Hindus and IndiaBangladesh: Tarique Rahman, delivering his first speech in Bangladesh in 17 years, invoked Martin Luther and said, 'I have a plan'. Through his speech and previous statements, Tarique has given glimpses of what his plan holds for Bangladesh, Hindus and India.
Dhurandhar enters Rs 1,000 crore club in 21 days - biggest Indian film of 2025Ranveer Singh-starrer Dhurandhar mints Rs 1,000 crore globally, one of the highest grossing films of 2025

Will India hand over Sheikh Hasina? History shows even a partridge wasn't betrayedProtecting someone who has sought refuge, even by sacrificing their own life, has been a civilisational ethos of Indians. Those demanding that India hand over Sheikh Hasina should be told how 200 people gave their lives to shield an injured partridge in Gujarat's Muli. From Jam Sataji and Hamir Dev Chauhan to India sheltering the Dalai Lama, this is a dharma that Indians have taken pride in and stayed true to.

Rabri Devi begins vacating 10 Circular Road, belongings moved in the dead of nightRabri Devi has started vacating the iconic 10 Circular Road bungalow, ending the Lalu family's nearly two-decade-long hold on the residence. This marks a significant political shift in Bihar as the family moves out from their traditional power base.

Suicide bid at Mecca Grand Mosque, hero security guard breaks man's fallA suicide attempt at Masjid al-Haram in Makkah was foiled after Saudi security personnel swiftly intervened, preventing a fatal fall; the officer suffered fractures during the rescue.

Indian student, 20, shot dead near Toronto campus; hunt on for culpritShivank Avasthi, an Indian doctoral student, was shot dead near the University of Toronto Scarborough campus. Toronto police said he was gunned down in the Highland Creek Trail–Old Kingston Road area.

When some in NDA sought Vajpayee's exit, Mamata stood like a rockSome within the NDA flirted with the idea of moving beyond Atal Bihari Vajpayee and running a government without him after he lost the no-confidence motion in 1999. However, TMC chief Mamata Banerjee and the MDMK's Vaiko made it clear there would be no NDA without Vajpayee at the helm, recalls the ex-PM's media advisor Ashok Tandon.

Bihar man, who married thrice in 3 years without divorcing wives, arrestedThe case came to light after the two women approached police, alleging that Barnwal, the accused, repeatedly married women for financial gain and abandoned them after subjecting them to torture.

Live: Dhaka sees massive Hindu Mahajot protest over Dipu Das lynchingBangladesh Violence Live Updates: A Hindu man has been beaten to death in Bangladesh, the second such killing in days, heightening concerns over the safety of religious minorities in the country. Local media reported that 29-year-old Amrit Mondal, also known as Samrat, was attacked and killed in Rajbari's Pangsha sub-district late on Wednesday night, around three-and-a-half hours from Dhaka. The killing follows the lynching of Dipu Chandra Das, whose body was set on fire earlier this week. The latest incident coincides with the return of senior opposition leader Tarique Rahman to Bangladesh after 17 years in self-imposed exile, as he pledged to ensure safety and justice if his party wins next year's elections. Stay with IndiaToday.com for live updates-

Udaipur IT firm CEO, female executive, husband offer lift to colleague, rape herUdaipur Police arrested a private firm's CEO, a senior executive and her husband after a female staff alleged gang rape in a moving car, with medical reports and dashcam footage backing complaint.

US bombs Nigeria over attacks on Christians, Trump wishes dead terrorists Merry XmasNigeria has faced years of extremist violence from Islamic State (IS) terrorists and Boko Haram, with attacks often hitting civilians and religious communities across the country's north.

They asked for our Aadhaar: Co-worker recalls lynching of Bengal man in OdishaPolice arrested six men after a 19-year-old migrant worker from West Bengal was killed in Odisha. The victim's co-workers alleged that the attackers demanded Aadhaar cards, suspecting them to be Bangladeshis.

Married woman shot in Gurugram club for rejecting friend's marriage proposalA Delhi man allegedly shot a 25-year-old married woman inside a Gurugram club after she rejected his marriage proposal. Police arrested the accused and his accomplice from Uttar Pradesh, and the investigation is ongoing.

Not just Christians, assault on all of us: Shashi Tharoor on Christmas vandalismCongress MP Shashi Tharoor has expressed deep concern over rising fear and anxiety among Christians in India ahead of Christmas 2025, citing multiple attacks and disruptions. He emphasises that these incidents threaten the nation's shared culture and calls for urgent government action to uphold constitutional freedoms.

Is that a UFO? Glowing object seen in skies sparks speculationThe footage, shared by NOIRlab, shows a bright trail arcing overhead against a starry backdrop, perfectly timed with operations near the NSF-DOE Vera C. Rubin Observatory.

Junta with nuclear weapons, US should worry: What Putin told Bush about Pak in 2001When expressing his views on Pakistan to George W. Bush, Putin wondered why the idea of a country with "no democracy" possessing a nuclear stockpile did not concern the West.

From junkyard to genius: Surat students build India's first AI superbike GarudaThree mechanical engineering students from Surat have built 'Garuda', India's first AI-enabled electric bike prototype made using nearly 50% scrap material. Driven by a Raspberry Pi–based system with sensors, cameras and voice-command controls, the Tesla-inspired bike highlights how young innovators are reshaping sustainable, intelligent mobility.

Trivandrum triumph a foregone conclusion? India eye series win vs toothless Sri LankaIND-W vs SL-W, 3rd T20I: Harmanpreet Kaur's side have dominated the five-match T20I series so far, winning both matches in Vizag and now looking to carry that momentum into Trivandrum.

sports.headline: Australia's Pat Cummins targets T20 World Cup return after Ashes cameo Australia captain Pat Cummins says he is "cooling his heels a little bit" as he targets a return at next year's ICC T20 World Cup, following his comeback in the third Ashes Test in Adelaide after a back injury ruled him out of the opening two matches.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi conferred National Children's Award by President Murmu Vaibhav Suryavanshi was honoured with the Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar award today by the President of India, Droupadi Murmu, in New Delhi.

Josh Tongue ends England's 27-year wait before record MCG crowd on Boxing Day Ashes, Boxing Day Test: Josh Tongue starred with a five-wicket haul as England bowled out Australia for 152 on Day 1 at the MCG. His performance ended a 27-year wait for an England five-for at the venue.

Virat Kohli hits rapid 77 in Bengaluru after Rohit Sharma's golden duck in Jaipur Virat Kohli scored 77 runs against Gujarat in the Vijay Hazare Trophy 2025-26. Despite a strong start, he missed out on his second successive century in the tournament.

No show: Rohit Sharma out for 0 in Jaipur, disappointed fans leave stadium Rohit Sharma was dismissed for a golden duck in the Vijay Hazare Trophy match against Uttarakhand. The early wicket left fans disappointed after they braved the winter morning cold to fill the Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur.

Special Report: Ashish Limaye's Historic Asian Gold and Jitu Virwani's Vision for Indian Equestrian In this special report, India Today explores the resilience of Indian equestrian sports amidst administrative crises. Ashish Limaye, the first Indian to win an individual gold at the Asian Equestrian Championships, describes his victory as 'a dream come true' and 'unbelievable'. The report highlights the pivotal role of Jitu Virwani, Chairman of Embassy Group, whose Embassy International Riding School (EIRS) in Bengaluru has become a cradle for champions like Limaye and Fouaad Mirza. Despite the Equestrian Federation of India (EFI) facing infighting and a split Junior National Equestrian Championship, private initiatives like EIRS are ensuring the sport's future. Virwani shares his vision of making the sport 'affordable and accessible' to create a legacy of champions.

Vijay Hazare Trophy live score: Kohli out for 77, Rishabh Pant hits 50 for Delhi Vijay Hazare Trophy live: Virat Kohli has hit a rapid 29-ball fifty for Delhi against Gujarat. He has looked at his aggressive best. Earlier, Rohit Sharma got dismissed for golden duck against Uttarakhand.

Harmanpreet on the cusp of history, set to surpass Meg Lanning's major record Harmanpreet Kaur is one win away from becoming the most successful T20I captain in history. She will surpass Meg Lanning to occupy the top of the list with another victory against Sri Lanka.

2026 beckons: Can Rinku Singh finally boss India's T20I middle order? Rinku Singh hasn't enjoyed the best run in T20 cricket over the past couple of years, but a solid campaign at next year's T20 World Cup could prove to be a game-changer for him in the shortest format.

Rohit Sharma's lookalike? Meet Hardik Tamore, Mumbai player who has gone viralRohit Sharma returned to the Vijay Hazare Trophy with a scintillating hundred against Sikkim. A moment from the game involving Rohit and Mumbai keeper Hardik Tamore went viral on the internet.

How Embassy Riding Club and Ashish Limaye are reshaping equestrian in IndiaAshish Limaye's Asian gold medal marks a turning point for Indian equestrian sport. Private initiatives like Embassy Riding School are vital amid federation challenges to nurture future talent.

Kartik Sharma on Rs 14.2 crore IPL deal: First, I'll repay my father's loansYoung Kartik Sharma fetched a massive sum of Rs 14.20 crore from Chennai Super Kings in the IPL auction. Sharma revealed how he wanted to spend his money.

Deepti Sharma recovers, but is Jemimah Rodrigues fit? India coach shares an updateIND vs SL: India Women are monitoring Jemimah Rodrigues' minor fitness issue ahead of the third T20I against Sri Lanka, while Deepti Sharma's return gives the team management a selection headache.

BPL 2026: Noakhali Express boycott training, coaches charge out of ground in angerNoakhali Express found themselves at the centre of a controversy in the 2026 Bangladesh Premier League (BPL) when coaches Khaled Mahmud Sujon and Talha Jubair stormed out of the ground in frustration over inadequate training facilities in Sylhet.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma return to action. Will BCCI livestream matches?Vijay Hazare Trophy returns with its Round 2 fixtures on Boxing Day. Centurions Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are expected to play on Friday, but will the BCCI livestream the games?

WPL 2026: When and how to buy tickets for upcoming seasonThe tickets for the Women's Premier League (WPL) 2026 will go live on December 26. The tournament is scheduled to take place from January 9 to February 5 in Navi Mumbai and Vadodara.

After T20 World Cup snub, Shubman Gill returns to intense batting practice sessionShubman Gill has responded to his T20 World Cup snub by returning to intense domestic preparations, even as questions grow over his T20 future following further omissions and recent struggles in the format.

SA20 returns for fourth edition: Full teams, format and live-streaming detailsThe fourth edition of the SA20 will get underway on Boxing Day, 26 December 2025, as South Africa prepares for another high-octane season of franchise cricket. Here is all you need to know

No voting rights for clubs in Equestrian Federation elections: Delhi High CourtThe Delhi High Court has ruled that clubs affiliated with the Equestrian Federation of India cannot vote in federation elections. This decision reinforces the governance role of state and Union Territory associations, impacting EFI's electoral structure.

Boozy break behind them, England hope Santa ends Ashes hangover in Boxing Day TestAUS vs ENG: England have already conceded the Ashes, but there is still plenty to play for, especially with the team languishing in the bottom half of the table in the 2025–27 World Test Championship cycle.

Watch: Hardik Pandya ignores abusive fan after refusing selfie requestIndian all-rounder Hardik Pandya remained calm and composed after a fan hurled abuse at him outside a restaurant, earning praise for handling the situation with restraint.

Virat Kohli fully ready for World Cup: Childhood coach backs India legendVirat Kohli is fully ready for the 2027 ODI World Cup, believes his childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma, after the India great marked his return to the Vijay Hazare Trophy with a commanding, record-breaking century for Delhi.

MS Dhoni's role in Jharkhand's historic Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy triumph revealedJSCA joint secretary Shahbaz Nadeem said that MS Dhoni's inputs were taken at every stage of the appointment process before Jharkhand went on to win their first Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy.

Virat Kohli in Vijay Hazare Trophy: Andhra bowler meets his God of CricketVijay Hazare Trophy: For B Vinay Kumar, a young cricketer from Andhra, meeting Virat Kohli and watching him bat felt surreal. Moments like these show why the presence of star players in domestic cricket is important.

16-year-old Tanmay Chaudhary steals the show in DC School CupSixteen-year-old Tanmay Chaudhary announced himself as one of Delhi's most exciting young batting prospects after producing a series of standout performances in the DC School Cup, highlighted by the rare feat of hitting six sixes in an over.

Have India's selectors clarified Yashasvi Jaiswal's white-ball future?Former India captain Dilip Vengsarkar has questioned the selectors for repeatedly leaving Yashasvi Jaiswal out of India's white-ball squads. Jaiswal was not picked in India's squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026.

Manchester United need a saviour? Ex-bidder offers co-owner fresh funds to fix clubFormer Manchester United bidder Thomas Zilliacus has resurfaced with a renewed £375 million proposal for the English club, a move that could inject immediate financial momentum as the Premier League giants approach the January transfer window.

No room for Shubman Gill even in ex-opener's T20 World Cup alternative squadFormer India opener Aakash Chopra did not include Shubman Gill in his alternative T20 World Cup squad, which featured the likes of Yashasvi Jaiswal, KL Rahul, Rishabh Pant and Ruturaj Gaikwad. Gill, who was vice-captain until last month, was also left out of India's 15-man squad for the showpiece event, which begins on February 7.

Watch: Rohit Sharma hugs young Virat Kohli fan during Vijay Hazare clash in JaipurRohit Sharma's Vijay Hazare return delivered runs and a touching moment in Jaipur. A spontaneous hug with a young Virat Kohli fan captured the emotion and enduring magic of India's domestic circuit.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
